page.title: 10FARMING
page.content: Farming is influenced by three main factors,{1,soil.}This consists of wet acid silts and clays and is therefore more suitable to grass growing than arable crops.{2,climate.}Average rainfall is 1015-1524mm per year and although temperatures on the whole are mild, except in January and February, we do suffer from very strong westerly winds.{3,politics.}This is a dairy and livestock area and those farmers producing milk have recently had the production curtailed by the Quota System introduced by the EEC to try and reduce the butter and milk surplusses in the Community.Less than a quarter of the land is given over to corn growing and that is mainly barley for stock feed.
